overview: From 2025-06-22 to 2025-06-29, elizaos-plugins/registry had 4 new PRs (1 merged), 0 new issues, and 14 active contributors.

topPRs.title: Add @bealers/plugin-mattermost to registry

topPRs.body:
This PR adds @bealers/plugin-mattermost to the registry.

- Package name: @bealers/plugin-mattermost
- GitHub repository: github:bealers/plugin-mattermost
- Version: 0.1.6
- Description: Mattermost client plugin for ElizaOS - enables AI agent integration with Mattermost chat platforms

Submitted by: @bealers

topPRs.title: feat: add TokenMetrics plugin to registry
topPRs.author: ashuxshimra
topPRs.body:
## üéØ Plugin Submission: Token Metrics Crypto Trading & Market Data Plugin

### üìã Plugin Details
- **Package Name**: `@elizaos/plugin-tokenmetrics`
- **Repository**: https://github.com/token-metrics/plugin-tokenmetrics
- **Category**: Cryptocurrency Trading & Market Data Analysis
- **License**: MIT
- **Maintainer**: Token Metrics Team 

### üèóÔ∏è File Structure & Paths

plugin-tokenmetrics/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ README.md # Comprehensive documentation (650+ lines)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ LICENSE # MIT License
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ package.json # Package configuration with proper @elizaos naming
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ tsconfig.json # TypeScript configuration
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ src/
‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ index.ts # Main plugin export
‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ actions/ # 21+ action implementations
‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ price.ts # Real-time price data
‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ trading-signals.ts # AI trading recommendations
‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ technical-analysis.ts # Technical indicators
‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ sentiment.ts # Market sentiment analysis
‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ ... (17 more actions)
‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ providers/ # Service providers
‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ evaluators/ # Response evaluators
‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ types/ # TypeScript definitions
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ dist/ # Built JavaScript files


### üöÄ Core Features & Capabilities
- **üìä 21+ TokenMetrics API Endpoints**: Complete integration covering all major crypto data categories
- **üí∞ Real-time Market Data**: Live prices, market cap, volume, and trading metrics
- **üéØ AI-Powered Trading Signals**: Buy/sell/hold recommendations with confidence scores
- **üìà Technical Analysis**: RSI, MACD, moving averages, and advanced indicators
- **üß† Sentiment Analysis**: Social media sentiment and market psychology insights
- **üìã Portfolio Management**: Risk assessment, allocation recommendations, and performance tracking
- **üîç Token Intelligence**: Comprehensive token research and fundamental analysis
- **üåê Natural Language Processing**: Context-aware query understanding and intelligent responses

### üõ†Ô∏è Technical Implementation
- **‚úÖ Tested with ElizaOS AI Agent**: Integrated with ElizaOS AI Agent and successfully tested it.
- **‚úÖ ElizaOS Plugin Standards**: Implements complete Plugin interface with proper action/evaluator structure
- **‚úÖ TypeScript Excellence**: Full type safety with comprehensive interfaces and type definitions
- **‚úÖ Memory Management**: Context-aware conversations with intelligent state management
- **‚úÖ Production Ready**: Comprehensive testing, build pipeline, and distribution setup

### üìö Documentation Quality
- **‚úÖ Comprehensive README**: 650+ lines with complete setup, configuration, and usage examples
- **‚úÖ API Documentation**: Detailed endpoint coverage with request/response examples
- **‚úÖ Integration Guide**: Step-by-step ElizaOS integration instructions
- **‚úÖ Natural Language Examples**: Real-world query patterns and expected responses
- **‚úÖ Troubleshooting Guide**: Common issues and solutions with verification commands

### üéØ Registry Integration
- **Package Name**: `@elizaos/plugin-tokenmetrics` (following ElizaOS naming convention)
- **Repository Path**: `github:token-metrics/plugin-tokenmetrics`
- **Clean Commit**: Single focused commit with descriptive message
- **File Changes**: Only `index.json` modified with 1 addition, 0 deletions


### üí° Value Proposition
This plugin transforms ElizaOS agents into sophisticated cryptocurrency trading assistants with access to institutional-grade TokenMetrics data, AI-powered insights, and comprehensive market analysis capabilities. It provides one of the most complete crypto data integrations available for any AI agent framework.

### üéØ Example Natural Language Queries
- "What's the current price of Bitcoin and should I buy now?"
- "Show me trading signals for Ethereum"
- "Analyze the sentiment around Solana"
- "Give me a portfolio recommendation for DeFi tokens"
- "What are the top performing altcoins this week?"

### ‚úÖ PR Requirements Checklist
- [x] **Clean Commit**: Single focused commit with descriptive message
- [x] **Clear Description**: Comprehensive plugin overview with technical details
- [x] **Proper Folder Paths**: Complete file structure and organization documented
- [x] **Alphabetical Positioning**: Correctly placed in registry index.json
- [x] **Production Ready**: Full TypeScript support, comprehensive documentation
- [x] **MIT License**: Open source license included
- [x] **Maintainer Permissions**: Enabled for conflict resolution
- [x] **ElizaOS Standards**: Follows all plugin development guidelines

---

**üîó Repository**: https://github.com/token-metrics/plugin-tokenmetrics  
**üìß Contact**: Available via GitHub issues in plugin repository  
**üë• Team**: TokenMetrics Development Team

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **Chores**
  * Added a new plugin entry for "@elizaos/plugin-tokenmetrics" to the configuration.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

topPRs.title: add: plugin-bonsai
topPRs.author: imthatcarlos
topPRs.body:
# Registry Update Checklist

Registry:
- [x] I've made the left side of the colon of JSON entry in index.json match the potential NPM package name
- [x] I've used github not github.com
- [x] There is no .git extension
- [x] It's placed it alphabetically in the list
- [x] I've dealt with commas properly so the list is still valid JSON

If not an eliza-plugins official repo, i.e. new plugin: 

The plugin repo has:
- [x] is publically accessible (not a private repo)
- [x] uses main as it's default branch
- [x] I have include `elizaos-plugins` in the topics in the GitHub repo settings. If the plugin is related to `AI` or `crypto`, please add those as topics as well.
- [x] add simple description in github repo
- [x] follows this convention
```
plugin-name/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ images/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ logo.jpg        # Plugin branding logo
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ banner.jpg      # Plugin banner image
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ src/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ index.ts        # Main plugin entry point
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ actions/        # Plugin-specific actions
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ clients/        # Client implementations
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ adapters/       # Adapter implementations
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ types.ts        # Type definitions
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ environment.ts  # runtime.getSetting, zod validation
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ package.json        # Plugin dependencies
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ README.md          # Plugin documentation
```
- [x] an `images/banner.jpg` and `images/logo.jpg` and they
  - Use clear, high-resolution images
  - Keep file sizes optimized (< 500KB for logos, < 1MB for banners)
  - Follow the [elizaOS Brand Guidelines](https://github.com/elizaOS/brandkit)
  - Include alt text for accessibility
- [x] package.json has a agentConfig like the following
```json
{
  "name": "@myNpmOrg/plugin-example",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "agentConfig": {
    "pluginType": "elizaos:plugin:1.0.0",
    "pluginParameters": {
      "API_KEY": {
        "type": "string",
        "description": "API key for the service"
      }
    }
  }
}
```

## Discord username
`imthatcarlos`



<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * Added a new plugin: Bonsai Plugin, making it available for use.
* **Bug Fixes**
  * Corrected version information for the Bootstrap plugin to ensure consistency.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

topContributors.summary: wtfsayo: Led a significant refactoring effort in `elizaos/eliza` by merging 19 pull requests, most notably adding a type-safe API client (`#5240`) and fixing macOS CLI test failures (`#5250`), resulting in over +50k/-38k lines changed. Other key contributions included improving character plugin configurations (`#5302`) and updating API documentation (`#5280`). This work was part of a highly active week with 117 commits, 4 issues created, and consistent contributions across all 7 days.

0xbbjoker: Focused on the elizaos/eliza repository, merging 5 pull requests that mixed new features with bug fixes. The most significant contribution, elizaos/eliza#5264, added OpenRouter support with +865/-117 lines of code. They also provided 7 code reviews and left 6 comments on pull requests.

ChristopherTrimboli: Merged 4 pull requests in elizaos/eliza, highlighted by a major documentation update in #5236 (+9578/-7862 lines) and a large cleanup of CLI packages in #5237. He also opened a new proof-of-concept PR for a workflows plugin (#5299) and was active in code review, providing 13 reviews. Overall activity was focused on documentation and refactoring, with two smaller bug fixes merged as well (#5298, #5296).

yungalgo: Merged four pull requests in elizaos/eliza, including a major refactor to centralize directory detection logic (#5246, +6421/-2262) and a feature for agent-scoped plugins (#5270) that was later rolled back (#5297). This work involved 53 commits across 162 files, resulting in a net change of +5264/-4421 lines. They also provided feedback through 11 PR comments and 2 code reviews.

tcm390: Merged 8 pull requests in the elizaos/eliza repository, contributing a mix of bug fixes and features totaling +8468/-1585 lines of code. The most significant change was elizaos/eliza#5248, which added a background color to dialog content (+5415/-561 lines). They also opened one new pull request (elizaos/eliza#5261) during a moderately consistent week of activity.

snobbee: Worked on a significant build fix and deployment configuration with an open PR #5277 that modified 224 files (+14,809/-3,839 lines), with config files representing 71% of changes. Created and closed issue #5279 regarding a handler for delegate type TEXT_EMBEDDING, while maintaining moderate activity across 3 days of the week.

bealers: Merged a significant bugfix in elizaos/eliza#5287 (+4322/-3095 lines) and opened two new pull requests in the same repository. They also left 5 comments on other pull requests. Overall, their work across 16 commits modified 88 files (+5721/-3458 lines), with a focus on feature development and bugfixes.
0xtc23: Opened two pull requests in elizaos/eliza (#5300, #5301) to add a new "Gork" character persona.

Starts with "Samarthsinghal28: ". (Yes)
    2.  Highlights the most significant contribution (the huge PR). (Yes)
    3.  Emphasizes meaningful patterns (a single, large feature addition). (Yes)
    4.  Includes line counts. (Yes, +13013/-

standujar: Focused on a significant feature implementation, opening pull request elizaos/eliza#5288 with substantial code changes (+17,583/-9,626 lines) across 201 files. Active on three days this week, they also provided one pull request approval and one comment.

Dexploarer undertook a major refactoring effort, pushing 13 commits that modified 68 files (+1777/-9971 lines). This work, primarily focused on features and tests, is contained within the open pull request elizaos/eliza#5243.
valentinuuiuiu: Focused on a major feature push, opening pull request elizaos/eliza#5254. This single contribution modified 324 files with a substantial change of +17,775 and -8,528 lines.
lalalune: Opened pull request elizaos/eliza#5242 "Next" and commented on one issue.
shandongzhejiang: Merged one pull request, elizaos/eliza#5271, which corrected some comments in the elizaos/eliza repository (+3/-3 lines).
kilavvy: Merged one pull request in elizaos/eliza#5238 to correct typos in documentation and comments (+2/-2 lines).

odilitime: Merged one pull request, elizaos/eliza#5281 (+10/-2), as part of an occasional week of activity. Overall, they pushed 8 commits modifying 8 files (+279/-31 lines), with a focus on refactoring and other work.
eeemmmmmm: Merged one pull request in elizaos/eliza#5258 to polish documentation with minor error fixes (+2/-2 lines).
github-advanced-security: Provided 3 pull request reviews this week, all of which were comments.
monilpat: Provided 2 pull request reviews, approving both.
yehia67: Contributed to issue discussions by opening elizaos/eliza#5260 to propose a new plugin and adding two comments to other issues.
urosognjenovic: Contributed this week by opening one issue (elizaos/eliza#5249).
NBFinanceTech: Activity was limited to creating a single issue, elizaos/eliza#5268.
kamalbuilds: This week, kamalbuilds opened issue elizaos/eliza#5244 ("Deploy Eliza agents"). They also commented on one issue.
